title: More Jobs and More Raises at Small Businesses
sub_head: The latest NFIB employment survey finds small firms adding workers and lifting compensation.
body:
The U.S. economy is sending mixed signals but the consistent message from small firms is an intense desire to hire. Jobs increased and so did compensation in March. Thatâ€™s according to the latest monthly employment survey from the National Federation of Independent Business, due out later today.
Small firms added an unspectacular 0.16 worker per firm in March, but this number is definitely moving in the right direction. Small businesses added an average of 0.11 worker per firm in February after a flat January and an anemic 0.04 in December. Owners would be happy to add many more workers if only they could find them.
